headline.main: TRIBUTE TO THE MEMORY OF HUMBOLDT.; RESOLUTIONS, LETTERS, &c. Speeches by the Rev. Dr. Thompson, Prof. Lieber, Prof. Bache, Prof. Guyot and the Hon. George Bancroft. Meeting of the Geographical and Statistical Society.

docs.lead_paragraph: In compliance with a call issued by the NewYork Gecgraphical and Statistical Society, a meeting was held last night in the Hall of the Historical Society's building in Second-avenue, for the purpose of giving expression to the sense of regret with which the men of science in this country have heard of the death of ALEXANDER VON HUMBOLDT. The audience filled the Hall to overflowing.

headline.main: HOW NEW-YORKERS LIVE.; MEETING OF THE SANITARY ASSOCIATION. Interesting Report on the Domiciles of the City.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 8 o'clock last evening the Sanitary Association held a regular meeting in the Cooper Institute, General MATHER in the Chairman. General AGNEW having previously resigned the office, Mr. HARVEY T. CLEVELAND was elected Permanent Secretary. Mr. ELLIOTT, the Treasurer, having left town for the Summer, his resignation was accepted, and Mr. NATHANIEL HAYPEN was elected Treasurer.

docs.snippet: The arrival of the America at Halifax, so often postponed, actually occurred on Wednesday afternoon. The dates we thus receive are to the 21st ult.-three days later. The news is important. The Austrian army had continued its backward movement toward...
docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the America at Halifax, so often postponed, actually occurred on Wednesday afternoon. The dates we thus receive are to the 21st ult.-three days later. The news is important. The Austrian army had continued its backward movement toward the Ticino, abandoning Vercelli, and fixing its headquarters at Garlasco. The allies had occupied the former post;

docs.snippet: CHAMBER OF COMMERCE.--The Chamber of Commerce met at 1 P. M. yesterday, PELATIAH PERIT in the Chair. After the election of members previously nominated, and the announcement of donations, the Quarantine question came up for discussion. Mr. TILESTON...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHAMBER OF COMMERCE.--The Chamber of Commerce met at 1 P. M. yesterday, PELATIAH PERIT in the Chair. After the election of members previously nominated, and the announcement of donations, the Quarantine question came up for discussion. Mr. TILESTON claimed that personal quarantine was inconvenient and unsuitable to the times; moreover, it did not answer the purpose aimed at, inasmuch as yellow fever had never been in a single instance personally communicated.

headline.main: From Austrialia.; GREAT FIRES AT MELBOURNE--THE WATERWORKS TO BE ABANDONED--DISCOVERY OF A NEW MINERAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: GREAT FIRES AT MELBOURNE--THE WATERWORKS TO BE ABANDONED--DISCOVERY OF A NEW MINERAL. The bank Palestine, from Australia, brought to San Franetse, Melbourne files to the 26th February. Quite a destructive fire had occurred in Melbourne. A whole block, comprising fifty houses, mostly frame buildings belonging to laborers, were destroyed.

docs.snippet: ARRIVAL OF THE UNITED STATES FRIGATE MINNESOTA--The United States Steam-frigate Minnesota, Captain Du PONT, arrived below Boston on Saturday night, from Table Bay, Cape of Good Hope, after a passage of only 37 days.
docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE UNITED STATES FRIGATE MINNESOTA--The United States Steam-frigate Minnesota, Captain Du PONT, arrived below Boston on Saturday night, from Table Bay, Cape of Good Hope, after a passage of only 37 days.

docs.snippet: ATTEMPTED SUICIDE. - The conduct of a well-dressed German woman, apparently about seventeen years of age, attracted the attention of a gentleman while crossing from New York to Brooklyn in one the South Perry boats yesterday, and he was induced to...
docs.lead_paragraph: ATTEMPTED SUICIDE. - The conduct of a well-dressed German woman, apparently about seventeen years of age, attracted the attention of a gentleman while crossing from New York to Brooklyn in one the South Perry boats yesterday, and he was induced to follow her.
